title: Copies of emails sent are not saved in "sent" folder
content: I have had a Thunderbird email program for several years. Recently, when I send an email a copy of it is not saved in the "Sent" folder. My emails are received by reciepents. How do I fix the problem?
creator: jtabor1

title: Mark unread button on toolbar
content:
Thunderbird 'Supernova' 115.6.1 (64-bit)

I had a Mark `Unread button` on the email toolbar along with `Reply`, `Forward` `Archive` etc.

Then Thunderbird self imploded and I couldn't do anything with it. Ended up having to `Reset toolbars and controls` in `Help > Troubleshoot Mode`.

Now I've no access to the one-click efficiency of a `Mark Unread` button in this use case: "bugger it, this email is too long for me to read now, I'll mark unread to remind me to read later".

There's no button in the Customize pallette that I can move to the menu bar.

Developers need to remember some users despise the tap a mailbox item once, it loads in a `Message Pane` and is marked read in X seconds workflow. I don't even use the Message Pane.

Once users have found the hidden-by-default Customise pallette and opted into customising their experience, buttons and options should not be removed from their choices. Give us these options back!
creator: an0n1m0us

title: Not enough room to see the email message, at 1920x1800 display resolution with Windows set at 125%
content:
I am not sure exactly what you guys did but ever since I updated to the latest release there is very little room to see the actual email message. The From/To area now takes up much to much space. Also there is this awful "This is a draft message" bar that appears that makes it worse with a useless edit button.

Also when I double click on a message to open it in a new window it gets these yellow warnings and lots of dashed lines placed on it. The old one worked perfectly.

Also where the folders are displayed I cannot move the right side to display the full folder names.

Please advise if there is anything I can do. I never had these issues with the old one.

Thanks and regards, Len
creator: reder

title: Quick Search
content: Does Quick Search only use the email address when searching for messages, when using the Sender filter? I was putting in the last name and there were not correct results. When I manually found the message, I realized that the email address did not contain the persons last name.
creator: LemR

title: Why does my thunderbird email account not accept password to reply to emails?  I have a imac sonoma
content: Why does my thunderbird email account not accept password to reply to emails? I have a imac sonoma
creator: nave246

title: Thunderbird and Spectrum/charter.net
content: I have been using Thunderbird for years to access several @charter.net email addresses, lately administrated at Spectrum, which took over Charter. Everything was working normally until today. I can still receive emails, but when I send, I get an error message asking for a password: "password required for outgoing SMPT server" Manually entering a password in that error message box doesn't help. Spectrum support is not helpful beyond confirming that my email sends and receives normally as long as I access it on their website. Three clues: 1) Spectrum recently announced "new and improved" email. 2) One customer service person described my email addresses as "legacy". 3) My gmail address sends and receives just fine from Thunderbird as usual. Any insights appreciated! Thanks!
creator: cdierl

title: Thunderbird 115 UI fix FAQ
content:
Thunderbird 115's default UI is horrible in many ways. It would be extremely useful if the methods required to return it to how it was were assembled in one place, not just in dozens of individual questions.

What I want is a comprehensive list in one place. (If this new release had been done properly, there would be options to turn all these bad changes off and definitely no CSS should be required, but I gather it will be.) For a start:

  • how to get the title bar back
  • how to get rid of the ugly grey blobs behind the message counts
  • how to get the grey background back in the mailbox pane
  • how to get rid of the ugly, intrusive "CTRL + K" from the search boxes
  • how to edit the tool bar to make the ugly search box go away altogether
  • how to made the new message count less intrusive, preferably by putting it back the way it was (just bracketed, not in a bright blue circle)

Yes, we can search the internet for all these and many more, wasting hours of our time, but it would be much simpler if it was all in one place. Even better if it can be scripted.
creator: craig83

title: Can't send mails anymore
content: Since the last update I can't send mails with Thunderbird anymore. I still can download them but I can't reply or send newly composed messages outward. Please fix or advise how to solve this
creator: thomas.kerres

title: Duplicates continue to be generated at latest Thunderbird Version 115.6.1. Never solved by Developers, Final Solution??
content:
HELP HELP HELP Duplicates continue to be generated as of latest Thunderbird Version 115.6.1. Final Solution?? Running on my MacOS Ventura 13.6.3 (22G436). Fully updated and kept as my babe!! Same as my Thunderbird. Using the [**Remove duplicates...**] official tool to fix it, but continues to appear always after some time.

Use a lot of dayly maintenance on my mails, creating _new-folders_ continuously and moving mails depending on subjects as needed. Continuously maintaining, Always _empty-trash_ followed immediately by _compact-folders_ Always try to do weekly backups.

Duplicates Still never ended since so long been reported!! Any way to fix the issue once and forever??

Do not need/want to suffer a complete platform crash on my loved mailer. Would be a complete disaster. Obviously I keep on backing up once per week.

Thanks a million if you try to help, and kudos if you solve it. Take care.
creator: eduardo.carriles

content:

title: Attachments over 1MB are illegible
content:
Good morning,

with the new Thunderbird update (ver 115.6.1) attachments over 1MB are resized to 95.9k and are illegible. The mail configuration is IMAP with office 365 account. It occurs only with new incoming messages, old messages with attachments appear intact.

Cn you help me?
creator: stefano27

title: My calendars cannot be found anymore in thunderbird supernova
content:
I have a Thunderbird 64-bit installation on Windows 10 that has 2 gmail email accounts with calendars. All were working fine until a recent update of Thunderbird in december.

Some of my calendars were displaying a triangle with "!" in the Calendars list. I was unable to undo that. I UNSUBSCRIBED the Calendar, restarted Thunderbird, rebooted and then tried to add the Calendars. First account worked fine, but the second no. During the process to add a new calendar for the second account, thunderbird does not show me all the calendars of this account, like it always did (and it still does for the other account that works fine), it only shows the one with the email name (which I can add and works fine). In my gmail settings, I can get the other calendars "secret" ical url to add a new one in TB, but in this case I'm not allowed to make changes, TB says that its read only even if i don't click the choice "read only". If I use any other url given by gmail calendar, it asks for a password and TB says "The credentials you have entered were not accepted. Please check your settings."

I know that the password/authentication is correct, because this TB installation is using the same settings as those other devices, and the associated gmail email is working fine on the same installation, it is the other calendars of one account that is failing to add.

I've also removed and readded my email account to TB, and I get the same behavior. When adding the account, it looks for calendars and returns nothing, so I have to manually add the calendar.

Any suggestions on adding the calendars? Is there a log with more detailed into I can check?
creator: arianaserrano

title: Moving Thunderbird to a New Computer via Copying the Old C: Partition to the New Computer C: Partition
content:
I know there are instructions on how to copy certain folders from the old computer to the new one, but I have a slightly different question. I removed the hard drive from the old computer and have it in a case where I can now attach the old drive via a USB connection, to the new computer. If I were to copy the entire C: partition from the old computer to the new one, would that take care of getting all the Thunderbird folders where they need to be on the new computer? I pretty much need to do this anyway for all my other non-Thunderbird folders.

Thanks in advance for any help.

Stew
creator: s1gitlin

title: TBird steals my default email
content: I have Outlook for business, and used to be able to use TBird for personal on Windows 10. When I changed computers (Win11 now, and Office 2023) and installed TBird, (and yes, UNchecked the "make default) on set up), TBird steals my default. This is when I am trying to email a pdf or spreadsheet, etc. where I click the email button and it generates an email with the file name as the subject. Rather than using my default Outlook (business account, mind you), the file opens in TBird. I've gone through every default in Windows, and cannot seem to locate a means of changing it in the INSTALLED version of TBird. I've uninstalled, and reinstalled multiple times ... all with the same results. Can anyone give me some insight, please? Teri HendersoTL@gmail.com

title: Underline Shortcut conflicting with search and replace
content:
Since Thunderbird version 102, the shortcut for search and replace witch was suposed to be CTRL + H has been replace for CTRL + U (also the shortcut for underline ), in write message box. This made undeline via shortcut stop working as the search and replace function has some kind of priority over underline.

Acourding to documentation, the correct shortcut for Search an replace should be CTRL + H so this seams to be some kind of bug. also tested in Version 105 and got same error.

https://support.mozilla.org/pt-BR/kb/atalhos-de-teclado-do-thunderbird?redirectslug=keyboard-shortcuts&redirectlocale=en-US#thunderbird:win10:tb102

Screens showig th shortcut configuration for both funcions atached.

title: thunderbird erased my emails
content:
I recently downloaded thunderbird and have been adding my email accounts one at a time to test it out. It seemed to be working fine so I added my main business account hoping to make use of Thunderbirds tags. However, in the middle of reviewing filters (I had just added a filter to apply a tag to emails from a particular email address), Thunderbird seemed to scramble all of the emails (showed some jibberish in the email list, basically showing a long list of blank email subjects and all the same date of something in 1969...) and when it recovered, all of my emails had been deleted. Not only did it trash all of my emails, going back through 2023, but it also apparently emptied the trash. So it also deleted all the email on my server as well.

I did archive older emails in Apples Mail app (so they are "on my Mac") but there is now a six month gap. Fortunately, since I just switched web hosting services, many of my missing emails are still on the old server, but I can only apparently recover them by "exporting" them one at a time in RoundCube. But there are hundreds of business emails in that gap.

Is there any hope of recovering these lost emails easily? And what happened in Thunderbird that would have caused this?

Any answers would be appreciated.

Robert
creator: rtthompson693

title: How does your filter feature work
content:
Hi,

I do a filtering of multiple alias accounts pulling from zoho & they all go to the same inbox.

Thanks
creator: news8

title: Sub1/Sub2 folder created on server, Thunderbird says Sub1 doesn't exist
content:
Using IMAP with the latest Thunderbird over Windows 10.

When Sieve filters create a folder Sub1/Sub2 using "fileinto :create", most operations in Thunderbird that see that folder tree will trigger a "Mailbox doesn't exist" warning. The Sub1 folder is grey/disabled.

What is the "state" of these folders that causes them to be greyed. That is, what exactly does a greyed folder name indicate to us?

I'd like to know what we need to do from the Thunderbird client side OR the server side, even with Sieve, to make Sub1 a legitimate folder.

Related: Sub2 folders created on the server are not auto Subscribed. What can be done in the client app or on the server to automatically ensure new folders are all Subscribed? The only way I know how to do this is to manually go into the account Subscribe option in Thunderbird, Refresh, select all folders, click Subscribe, then OK/Save.

Similarly : Sub2 folders created on the server are not checked as "When getting new messages for this account, always check this folder" What is the difference between "always checking this folder" and "subscribed"? What can be done in the client app or on the server to automatically ensure new folders are all set to be checked when getting new messages?

As a developer I would be fine with looking at code, creating an Thunderbird addon, or coding some process in the server to change folder settings. But I need to understand exactly how and where these settings are made so that I know what code to write.

Thanks!
creator: Starbuck
